greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(1/4) * (eta(q) / eta(q^3))^3 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (f(-x) / f(-x^3))^3 in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (48 t)) = 3^(3/2) / f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
Convolution cube of A137569. Convolution square is A007262. Convolution fourth power is A030182.
a(0) = 1, a(n) = -(3/n)*Sum_{k=1..n} A046913(k)*a(n-k) for n > 0. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 28 2017
mathematica: QP = QPochhammer; s = (QP[q]/QP[q^3])^3 + O[q]^60; CoefficientList[s, q] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 25 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) / eta(x^3 + A))^3, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Nov 08 2011
